conversations.description: Agent uploads a single living‑room photo, selects “modern minimal” style, and receives a staged image with a sleek sofa and coffee table within minutes.
User provides a property address in Austin, TX; the system fetches all exterior and interior photos, analyzes each room, and proposes a cohesive Scandinavian design.
Realtor chooses “coastal summer” theme for a beach house; the LLM pulls 2025 summer colour trends and suggests light‑blue linen sofas and rattan accents.
Client sets a budget cap of $2,500 per room; the assistant searches the furniture catalog for affordable pieces that still match a mid‑century modern look.
Multiple‑room staging request for a 3‑bedroom condo; the LLM creates a consistent design flow, placing matching nightstands and artwork across rooms.
User uploads a kitchen photo with outdated cabinets; the system recommends a contemporary colour palette and inserts new cabinet fronts via image synthesis.
Agent needs a fast turnaround for a “open house tomorrow”; the LLM prioritises low‑complexity furniture and delivers staged images in under 30 minutes.
Seller wants a pet‑friendly staging; the LLM selects durable fabrics, neutral tones, and places a stylish pet bed in the living room.
Buyer requests a virtual remodel of a vacant lot; the assistant fetches satellite images, proposes a modern farmhouse layout, and renders a 3‑D staged concept.
Realtor selects “industrial loft” for an urban apartment; the LLM pulls current industrial trends and adds exposed‑brick wallpaper and metal‑frame furniture.
User provides only a list of photo URLs; the LLM fetches them, validates image quality, and begins the staging pipeline automatically.
Agent wants seasonal staging for a fall listing; the system retrieves autumn palettes and adds warm throw blankets and pumpkin‑shaped décor.
Client requests a “luxury boutique hotel” vibe for a high‑end property; the LLM sources premium furniture items and renders them with high‑resolution output.
Realtor needs consistent branding across several listings; the LLM applies a custom colour scheme and logo watermark to each staged image.
User wants to see how a room would look with a different flooring material; the assistant analyzes the floor type and swaps it with hardwood via synthesis.
Agent asks for a minimal staging of a studio apartment; the LLM selects space‑saving furniture and generates a clean, uncluttered visual.
Seller wants to showcase a possible home office setup; the LLM adds a stylish desk, ergonomic chair, and bookshelf to a vacant bedroom.
Realtor requests a “smart home” themed staging; the system includes sleek tech‑infused furniture and smart lighting fixtures.
User provides a photo with existing furniture; the LLM detects and removes it before inserting the new staged pieces.
Agent needs bulk staging for 10 properties; the LLM queues the jobs, reuses trend data, and delivers a zip file of all staged images.
Seller wants a “rustic cabin” look for a mountain retreat; the assistant fetches wood‑heavy trends and adds a stone fireplace and plaid sofa.
Realtor selects a bold colour accent wall; the LLM analyzes wall colour and proposes complementary furniture placements.
User asks for a child‑friendly staging; the LLM adds rounded‑edge furniture, soft rugs, and playful décor while respecting safety guidelines.
Agent wants to see a before‑and‑after slider; the system stores both original and staged images and returns URLs for side‑by‑side comparison.
Seller specifies a desire for eco‑friendly materials; the LLM filters catalog items for sustainable fabrics and recycled wood.
Realtor desires a “vintage glam” makeover; the assistant fetches 2025 vintage trends and adds velvet sofas and brass lighting.
User requests a virtual staging of a balcony space; the LLM analyses the outdoor view and inserts potted plants and a small seating set.
Agent wants to experiment with different sofa scales; the LLM generates multiple staged images showing various size options.
Seller provides a photo taken at night; the assistant enhances lighting, adds warm lamps, and renders a cozy evening ambience.
Realtor asks for a pet‑exclusive staging for a cat‑lover; the LLM adds a stylish cat tree and tasteful cat-themed accessories.
User wants a “no‑clutter” staging approach; the system selects a few statement pieces and leaves the rest of the space empty.
Agent requests a staged dining room for a holiday dinner; the AI adds a festive table setting and seasonal décor.
Seller wants a virtual staging with a view of the city skyline; the LLM crops the window area and inserts a realistic skyline background.
Realtor selects a “boho chic” style; the LLM pulls 2025 bohemian trends and adds patterned rugs, macramé wall hangings, and a low‑profile sofa.
User uploads low‑resolution images; the assistant upscales them before analysis to improve staging accuracy.
Agent needs a “virtual renovation” showing a wall removed; the LLM removes the wall using depth data and creates an open‑plan layout.
Seller wants a staged master bedroom with a luxury canopy bed; the LLM sources an elegant canopy and matches bedding for a high‑end look.
Realtor asks for a quick mockup of a potential kitchen remodel; the assistant swaps countertops and cabinets with modern alternatives.
User requests a “color‑swap” for a sofa to match a specific brand palette; the LLM recolors the selected furniture item accordingly.
Agent wants staged images stored in a client‑specific folder; the system uses the store_image tool with a designated folder path.
Seller is curious about how a room looks with a fireplace; the LLM synthesizes a realistic electric fireplace into the living‑room photo.
Realtor asks for a staged basement conversion into a home theater; the assistant adds recliner seats, a large screen, and acoustic panels.
User wants a “dual‑style” comparison—modern vs. traditional—displayed side by side for the same room.
Agent requests a budget‑optimized staging where each piece is under $300; the LLM filters catalog items accordingly.
Seller wants a staged patio with outdoor furniture and string lights for a summer listing.
Realtor asks for a staged entryway that maximizes perceived space using mirrors and slim console tables.
User wants to preview a staged bathroom with a freestanding tub and modern fixtures.
Agent needs a staged home office that complies with ergonomics standards; the LLM selects adjustable chairs and sit‑stand desks.
Seller requests a vintage kitchen upgrade with retro appliances; the assistant sources 1950s‑style fridge and stove models.
Realtor wants a staged nursery with soft pastel colours and child‑safe furniture.
User asks for a “virtual open house” video sequence generated from staged images of each room.
